intro: Galium zacynthium var. intricatum, commonly known as the intricate bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial with slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers, which are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. It is native to southern Europe and thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its delicate appearance and unique floral structure make it a notable species in botanical studies.
